![](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/fb9cd5696ce5ebd01f8ea7f85a0dcf9696509da4.svg)

Juan and Rob are selling cookie dough for a school fundraiser. Juan has $t$ cookie dough orders, and Rob has $40$ cookie dough orders. They have a total of $75$ cookie dough orders all together. 

**Write an equation to describe this situation.**

[[☃ expression 1]]

**How many cookie dough orders does Juan have?**

[[☃ numeric-input 1]]

hints.content: Juan has an unknown number of cookie dough orders, which we're calling $\blueD{t}$, and Rob has $\greenD{40}$ cookie dough orders. All together, they have $\maroonD{75}$ cookie dough orders.

We can represent Juan and Rob's cookie dough orders as a sum:

$\blueD{t} + \greenD{40}$

We know that together they have $\maroonD{75}$ cookie dough orders.

We can set these two expressions equal to describe this situation with an equation:

$\blueD{t} + \greenD{40} = \maroonD{75}$

Other ways to represent the situation with an equation include:   $\greenD{40} + \blueD{t} = \maroonD{75}$ or  $\maroonD{75} = \greenD{40} =\blueD{t}$, or  $\maroonD{75} - \blueD{t} = \greenD{40}$.

Now we can solve for $\greenD{t}$.

Subtract $\greenD{40}$ from both sides of the equation to get $\greenD{t}$ by itself:

$\begin{align} \blueD t +\greenD{40} -\greenD{40}  &= \maroonD{75}-\greenD{40}  \\
\\ 
\blueD{t} &=\blueD{35} \end{align}$

The following equation matches this situation:

$\blueD{t} + \greenD{40} = \maroonD{75}$

Juan has  $\blueD{35}$ cookie dough orders.
